poem:
Optimum

They would seal a carriage  
for the chosen,  
as though silence were holiness  
and a child's breath blasphemy.  

But the world is not a study  
with the door shut.  
It is a field with larks,  
and the small voices  
are part of the weather.  

To ban them  
is to ban tomorrow  
from travelling with us.

The service was promoted last month as a civilised space in which executives could conduct important business in cosseted peace, unmolested by sticky fingers or La Pat’ Patrouille (Paw Patrol) blaring from an iPad. Actually, though, I hate it – and a heartening number of other people seem to be hating it, too.
